title: Mobile App for Android & iOS to Track Calls/Texts
desc: Our company brokers boats & RVs.  Much like real estate, our salespeople with buyers and sellers. Currently, our sales reps are required to log all contact with their buyers and sellers.  With 300 sales reps and 770,000 customers, this is a lot of searching for your customer and logging contact activity.  Our aim with this app is to log that contact from and to their customers automatically for them, saving them time.We would like a mobile app developed and available for installation from the public app stores for our company contractors/employees.The primary goal of the app is to ping a URL on our server whenever an incoming or outgoing phone call or text message is received/sent.In the ping, we need the email address assigned by the user to the app (which will be a company email address) and the applicable details of the phone call/text message that we can get.The opening screen of the app would need to inform users that this app can only be used by employees and licensed contractors of our company.  There should be a button to authenticate using Google, which is the provider of our email addresses.Once authenticated through Google, the app would need to ping our server and we will respond with whether this is a valid email address or not.  If the email address is not in the format [user]@[url removed, login to view], there is no need to even ping our server, since it won't be valid.  Display an error to the user in these cases.If the email address is proper and our server responds with success, then the second screen in the app should display.The second screen should indicate that we need several permissions in order to track their phone call and text message activity.  On click of an Ok button, the user should be prompted with the requisite permissions necessary.Once the permissions are confirmed, the user needs to be presented with a test button that dials a specific phone number (will provide).  On dial of that number, our system will respond with a voice telling them they can hang up their phone and check their email.  The app will presumably send a ping to our server w/ their authenticated email address and the number dialed.  We will email the user that their phone call was indeed logged correctly.  The test button should be available from a menu for later testing.The app shouldn't solely be focused on these permissions.  While this is all we currently envision, the app should be built with a grander future in mind.  The opening screen is our logo, and a Google button to authenticate.  Once authenticated, they are taken to this permissions screen, but it should ultimately only be one page in an app that could have more functionality later.That's it!Nice to haves would be:- The text/attachments to the text message.- Another ping when the phone call ends, so we can track the length of the call.- Other details about the call, for example was it answered by the user or did it go unanswered.- The ability to turn on/off each of the permissions, using toggles?

title: Important Days – APP
desc: The Important Days is an App which can help the users to remind of the important days so that they will not miss them.The Important Days is free for the users and they do not create an account. On the main interface, there is a brief list about all the important days which contains the main matter on that day, how much days have been started from the date or how much days are left before the date. The users can put all the briefs in an order according to the level of importance. On the right top corner of the interface, there will be a link to create a new day matter. The first step is to enter name of the matter which will happen or has happened on the date. Then to choose the date in detailed. After that, there will some categories for users to choose, such as living, studying and Memorial Day. There are also some options below for the users, like whether to put this matter on the top of the list in the interface and whether to send a notice and how often to send it. For the frequent of notice, they can choose from every day, every week or every month. Finally the users can save the day matter and it will be back to the interface and on the list.When the day matters have been set, it can help to remind the users of their important days. The users can delete the matters when they feel it is no longer important.The project needs to be done as soon as possible and deadline is on 17th Nov 2017. And it is important we should keep in touch online so that the project will be done successfully since there is no time for us to adjust the project. If the project can be done earlier then there is still some time to test it.

title: create Local business directory app like yelp
desc: Create A Local Business Directory MapBusiness Owners can manage their own menu, deals, content, links and more. They can update their listing anytime with their own loginYou Can Sell Primary Listings To Business Ownersand offer push notificationsmultiplatform app for Android, iOS and on the webCustomize your app to suit your topic with a colour scheme, promo image and your logo.Powerful CMSYou’re in control of the app with the web based CMS. Businesses Owners are in control of their content.Instant Update on all DevicesEdit all content with the web CMS. Changes are saved in the cloud and instantly synced to apps on Android and iOS automatically.Locations / BusinessesEverything is a location. So are businesses. Add your selection in seconds.Import Locations from KMLCreate unlimited number of pages with a full WYSIWYG editor and add them to your menu. Add text, images, contact forms or import external URLs/Websites.EventsCreate and promote Events. If the event is taking place at an existing location, connect them with a click to show upcoming events at that location. Business Owners can create their own events too.Import Events from EventbriteEasily search through Eventbrite’s events and add them to your Guide with one click.Event RSVPLet users register for your events on web and mobile and get notified of registrations by email. Gather name, email, telephone and address details of event participants. Check current participants in an up-to-date list.User Roles and Right ManagementThe Guide Admin can invite unlimited number of Guide Editors that help manage the content with the web-based CMS. Location Admins and Location Editors only have the right to manage the content of their very own business. Simply invite new users by email and control privileges in the user management section.bPagesCreate unlimited number of pages with a full WYSIWYG editor and add them to your menu. Add text, images, contact forms or import external URLs/Websites.iPostsKeep your users up to date with everything you want to share. New content is what drives users to return to your app. Business Owners may use this feature to post news or offers.kFull WYSIWYG HTML EditorAll pages, posts, events and location details can be edited with a full WYSIWYG HTML editor. It’s your app, create your own style.FormsCreate contact forms, price draws or request forms and gather data from app users. Receive submitted data by email. Business Owners can use forms to generate leads to new customers.Import WebsitesImport websites to your pages and posts. Just enter the URL and let SimpleMapp render it on mobile and on the web.hPDFFull PDF compatibility. Upload a single PDF file to show in a page or post.Assemble Your App MenuYou decide what is important by including or excluding items, changing the order or moving items to the footer menu. Business Owners can change their dedicated location menu on their own.Internal and External LinksLink all the content with eachother, from pages, posts, locations, events or categories to create an individual experience. Include links to external websites, Facebook, Twitter or blogs too.ImagesAdd unlimited number of images to locations/businesses and events or let Business Owners add them to their own location.zAudioGot audio files related to a location or eventVideosAdd Videos to locations and events to make them more appealing!dCategories, Tags and Special CategoriesOrganize businesses, events and posts in categories and subcategories.Primary ListingsSell Primary Listing options to Business Owners so they can increase their visibility within the app.Usage StatisticsTrack usage statistics such as likes, page views or number of push messages sent.Show Advertismentspaypal gateway for business holders to subscribe or claim listing

title: iOS App for iPhone 7+ which uses Google Calendar as technology framework
desc: I am trying to create a simplified version of Google calendar for a relative that is losing their short term memory. They are finding it difficult to stay on top of what they need to do each day. The current Google calendar format is too complex for them and they get lost in all the different functionality - i want to simplify and lock it all down so it is helpful for them, instead of confusing. The basics of what I need are listed below. I also mocked up a screenshot of what i need (attached).In the header for the app:•	User’s Google+ Profile Image•	Message reads “Hi Grace, it’s {Day, PartOfDay} where PartOfDay = {Morning, Afternoon, Night}The remaining space on the screen is a dynamic calendar view•	The view locked so that is shows current and future events for today only•	Basic format can match the new google calendar design guidelines – pulls in any required info (eg images, text) from google calendar API•	Instead of showing times, it shows time to each event from now eg: In 2 Hours•	Once event is finished, it is removed from the calendar viewOther requirements:•	No ability to click into an event•	No ability to edit or modify an event•	Cannot minimize app or close the app without clicking on the home button on the iphoneLoading strategy of data:•	when you create an event on the back-end it updates immediately on the iOS app.•	This is critical. The app does NOT poll the server, rather the dev uses a framework to receive a push when an event occurs.Deliverable•	Deliverable is IPA file•	All source code (the xCode project) as well as any server code (ie heroku for intercepting event notifications)
